name: Nova Palindrome
description: Palindromes mined after the first Bitcoin halving, shortly following the 'palindrome extinction event'

name: Pizza Palindromes
description: Palindromic sats from the 2010 'Bitcoin Pizza Day' transaction, where 2 pizzas were bought for 10,000 BTC, marking Bitcoin's first real-world purchase

name: Vintage Palindromes
description: Palindromes from the first 1,000 Bitcoin blocks

name: 2009 Alphas
description: Alphas from 2009, the year Bitcoin began to shape its early legacy

name: 3D Palindromes
description: Palindromes consisting of just 3 repeated digits

name: Pre-First Halving Black Uncommons
description: Black Uncommons mined before the first halving event

name: Nova 3D Palindrome
description: 3D Palindromes mined after the first Bitcoin halving, shortly following the 'palindrome extinction event'

name: 3D Paliblock Palindromes
description: 3D palindromes featuring a block number that is itself a palindrome

name: 3D Uniform Palinception
description: 3D uniform palinceptions, where the palindrome structure is made up of smaller palindromes of equal length

name: Pre-First Halving Uncommons
description: Uncommons mined before the first halving event

name: Vintage Paliblock Palindromes
description: Vintage palindromes featuring a block number that is itself a palindrome

name: 2009 Black Uncommons
description: Black Uncommons from the year Bitcoin was created

name: Rodarmor Names
description: Sat names featured in the Ordinal Bounty 3, a challenge rewarding hunters for discovering names based on the Google Books dataset

name: Nakamoto Palindromes
description: Palindromic sats mined by the man himself

name: Paliblock Alphas
description: Alphas from a palindromic block

name: Paliblock Omegas
description: Omegas from a palindromic block

name: Vintage 3D Palindromes
description: 3D palindrome originating from the first 1,000 Bitcoin blocks

name: Hitman Palindrome
description: Palindromic sats from the hitman transaction

name: 3/5 Uniform Palinception
description: A rare palinception featuring sub-palindrome lengths of both 3 & 5, e.g. 17171-70107-17171 / 171-717-010-717-171

name: Perfect Palinceptions
description: Perfect palinceptions, made up of identical smaller palindromes of equal length, creating a flawlessly symmetrical and balanced sequence

name: 2009 Uncommons
description: Uncommons from the year Bitcoin was created

name: Jpeg Palindromes
description: Palindromes from what is believed to be the first Bitcoin trade for an image

name: Pizza Alphas
description: First sats of each Bitcoin from the legendary pizza transaction

name: Paliblock 3D Uniform Palinceptions
description: 3D uniform palinceptions, where the palindrome structure consists of smaller palindromes of equal length, and the block number itself is also a palindrome

name: Block 78
description: The first sats mined by someone other than Satoshi Nakamoto. Hal Finney, a renowned cryptographer and early Bitcoin pioneer, mined this block.

name: Nova Perfect Palinceptions
description: Perfect Palinceptions mined shortly after the 'palindrome extinction event'

name: 420 Pizza Palindromes
description: Pizza Palindromes mined on April 20, 2010

name: Paliblock Uncommon
description: Uncommon sat from a  palindromic block

name: 2009 Pizza Palindromes
description: Pizza Palindromes mined in late 2009

name: 2010 Jpeg Palindromes
description: Jpeg Palindromes mined in early 2010

name: Nova Uniform Palinceptions
description: Uniform Palinceptions mined shortly after the 'palindrome extinction event'

name: Jpeg Alphas
description: First sats of each Bitcoin from the jpeg transaction

name: 2009 Pizza Alphas
description: First sats of each Bitcoin from the famous pizza transaction, mined in late 2009

name: 2D Perfect Palinceptions
description: Perfect Palinceptions containing only 2 unique digits

name: Paliblock Alpha Uncommon
description: Alpha Uncommons from a palindromic block

name: Paliblock Omega Black Uncommon
description: Omega Black Uncommons from a palindromic block

name: Palindromic Uncommon
description: Uncommons which resemble a palindrome, e.g. 123210000000000

name: Block 9
description: The first satoshis in circulation, used in the first-ever Bitcoin transaction.
